channel.title: Username hook help
channel.description:
I'm working on a hack for uid and I got it almost finished. But I need to know the username of the character. I found that it's stored as soon as you typed in when loggin in. The password is stored also, but that isn't what I need ;) The username is found here: t.W (deob: Class69.aClass65_1387)
Please help me with hooking this one :|, so I can finish the uid hack.
Edit: Nvm, did it myself ;) Search for D9.9999999E7 (in byte code), then next getstatic java.math.BigInteger then previous getstatic stringwrap is pass and the previous getstatic stringwrap is user.

item.title: Username hook help
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

True, but looking up a double in the ConstantPool is quicker then running trough each method in each class to find the getstatic biginteger. Because biginteger is called in multiple classes, you can’t easily look it up in the constantpool.
However everyone can choose how to make it’s own hook :).

Btw. UID hook is finished and works perfect

Read full topic

item.title: Username hook help
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

ehhhhhh, the only time the bigintegers are getstatic’edededed is during login

Read full topic

item.title: Username hook help
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

The double is the same in multiple releases, so this way it’s faster. Also biginteger is used a lot, and the double not 8)

Read full topic

item.title: Username hook help
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

imo just search for the bigintegers, not the 99999999amidoinitrite99999D, just makes more sense that way

Read full topic
